MQTTClient
an Objective-C Framework for MQTT

MQTTClient Documentation

an Objective-C native MQTT Framework http://mqtt.org

Tested with

  • mosquitto
  • paho
  • rabbitmq
  • hivemq
  • rsmb
  • mosca
  • vernemq
  • emqtt
  • moquette
  • ActiveMQ
  • Apollo
  • CloudMQTT
  • aws

Howto

Use the CocoaPod MQTTClient!

Or use the dynamic library created in the MQTTFramework target.

Or include the source from here.

Documentation

Usage

Create a new client and connect to a broker:

1 \@interface MyDelegate : ... MQTTSessionDelegate>
2 ...
3 
4  MQTTCFSocketTransport *transport = [[MQTTCFSocketTransport alloc] init];
5  transport.host = @"localhost";
6  transport.port = 1883;
7 
8  session = [[MQTTSession alloc] init];
9  session.transport = transport;
10 
11  session.delegate=self;
12 
13  [session connectAndWaitTimeout:30]; //this is part of the synchronous API

Subscribe to a topic:

1 [session subscribeToTopic:@"example/#" atLevel:2 subscribeHandler:^(NSError *error, NSArray<NSNumber *> *gQoss){
2  if (error) {
3  NSLog(@"Subscription failed %@", error.localizedDescription);
4  } else {
5  NSLog(@"Subscription sucessfull! Granted Qos: %@", gQoss);
6  }
7  }]; // this is part of the block API

Add the following to receive messages for the subscribed topics

1  - (void)newMessage:(MQTTSession *)session
2  data:(NSData *)data
3  onTopic:(NSString *)topic
4  qos:(MQTTQosLevel)qos
5  retained:(BOOL)retained
6  mid:(unsigned int)mid {
7  // this is one of the delegate callbacks
8 }

Publish a message to a topic:

1 [session publishAndWaitData:data
2  onTopic:@"topic"
3  retain:NO
4  qos:MQTTQosLevelAtLeastOnce]; // this is part of the asynchronous API
